author: Matt Bassil
description:
How many MTG sets are there? Wizards of the Coast has released 218 separate card collections over the game’s 32-year history, with four more coming soon: an average of seven new sets per year. To help you keep track, we compiled this complete list of all Magic: The Gathering sets ever made, going right back to the beginning in 1993 - as well as the new MTG sets about to join the party.

Continue reading All MTG sets in order, as of September 2025
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates,
title: All MTG sets in order, as of September 2025

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Games Workshop has announced Blood Bowl Third Season Edition, the inaccurately named seventh edition of its beloved board game of fantasy football teams kicking seven bells out of one another. Two new team kits will make their debut in the new edition’s starter set, the returning undead Tomb Kings, and the knightly Bretonnians.

Continue reading Games Workshop reveals Blood Bowl third edition, straight out of left field
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Warhammer 40K: Imperium factions guide, Warhammer 40K Combat Patrols guide, Warhammer 40K detachments guide
title: Games Workshop reveals Blood Bowl third edition, straight out of left field

author: Matt Bassil
description:
Would you believe there are still Generation 1 Pokémon that have never had a full art Pokémon card? The mammal-dinosaur ground type that took ‘skull cap’ a little too literally, Cubone, has never been featured on an Illustration Rare, Special Illustration Rare, or any card with extended art that goes beyond the usual border - until now that is.

Continue reading This Kanto Pokémon just got its first full-art rare card - but only in China!
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards, All Pokémon sets in order
title: This Kanto Pokémon just got its first full-art rare card - but only in China!

author: Matt Bassil
description:
What are the top commanders in Magic: The Gathering? We think about this a lot - sure, the best commanders are able to reliably secure wins, but they also have to be extremely fun to play. Your MTG commander is the legendary creature that leads your other 99 cards into an EDH battle, dictates the colors you can use, and shapes your overall strategy, so it’s vital to make the right choice. This guide tracks the absolute top tier commanders in MTG, as of September 2025.

Continue reading Top MTG Commanders in September 2025
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: Top MTG Commanders in September 2025

author: Mollie Russell
description:
On the surface, the new Discworld RPG is a game all about, as we Brits would call it, ‘playing silly buggers’. It’s a one-shot-friendly tabletop RPG system that encourages creative puns, general tomfoolery, and Antics with a capital A. Despite this, publisher Modiphius hasn’t shied away from Terry Pratchett’s tendency to make political points using comedic fantasy. In fact, when it comes to using Ankh-Morpork to discuss real-world issues, the Discworld RPG pulls zero punches.

Continue reading Shocking no one, the Discworld tabletop RPG gets extremely political
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best tabletop RPGs, Best fantasy wargames, Best fantasy board games
title: Shocking no one, the Discworld tabletop RPG gets extremely political

author: Matt Bassil
description:
Looking for the MTG Commander banlist? With such a vast format, knowing which cards you aren't allowed to use can be tricky. In this guide, you'll find a list of every card that's forbidden in Commander, complete with the date it was added to the EDH banlist.

For more bans in other formats, see our full  MTG banlist guide. We can also give you more details about upcoming MTG sets and the best MTG Arena decks to play after each new release.

Continue reading MTG Commander banlist September 2025
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order,
title: MTG Commander banlist September 2025

author: Matt Bassil
description:
To keep the game fair and fun, Wizards of the Coast regularly updates its MTG banlist, a compilation of cards that're banned (or restricted to a limited number of copies) in a constructed deck. Read on for a summary of the latest Magic banlist update; the complete, up-to-date banlists for each format; and all the rules information you need to know on banned cards.

Continue reading MTG banlist updates and announcements - September 2025
title: MTG banlist updates and announcements - September 2025

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Digital board games have a lot going for them - they’re extremely portable, you don’t have to set up the board, you can play online with friends, you don’t have to keep score, and with pass-and-play modes you can even play them in person. What they’re lacking is that sense of touch: the tactile experience of placing pieces, taking tokens, dealing cards. Bop It! The Video Game, a newly announced adaptation of the command-giving ‘90s kids toy, promises to take this to its logical extreme.

Continue reading Following the digital board game trend, we're getting Bop It! The Video Game
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games , Couples' board games, Board games for adults<
title: Following the digital board game trend, we're getting Bop It! The Video Game

author: Matt Bassil
description:
I’m yet to find a Magic: The Gathering fan in real life who has a good word to say about the upcoming Spider-Man crossover set. While Final Fantasy delighted the masses, it seems the Magic crowd turns its nose up at friendly neighbourhood superheroes. However, a couple of the newest spoilers have been incredible flavor wins, and it’s slowly bringing me back around on this release.

Continue reading MTG Spider-Man has some big flavor wins and it's finally winning me over
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: MTG Spider-Man has some big flavor wins and it's finally winning me over

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Games Workshop seems to be ramping up its operations in Japan, with job openings for Japanese Warhammer translators, a Tokyo store manager, and a new people manager. The firm already stated its intentions to expand its reach in Asia in its most recent annual report - sales via the firm’s retail stores in Japan grew 26% in the last financial year, and it seems it’s capitalizing on that boost.

Continue reading With booming Warhammer sales in Japan, Games Workshop sends in reinforcements
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Warhammer 40k starter sets, Best Warhammer 40k games, All Warhammer 40k factions
title: With booming Warhammer sales in Japan, Games Workshop sends in reinforcements

author: Mollie Russell
description:
WizKids has launched pre-orders for DnD Onslaught: Tomb of Horrors, a new expansion for its tabletop skirmish game. This adapts Gary Gygax’s iconic 1975 module, and it offers “brand-new cooperative gameplay” to (hopefully) increase your chances of surviving the brutal dungeon crawl. The expansion will hit retail in February 2026.

Continue reading DnD's most infamous dungeon gets reimagined as a skirmish game
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games for adults, Best 2-player board games, Best strategy board games
title: DnD's most infamous dungeon gets reimagined as a skirmish game
